articles.headline: Who’s Behind the Judicial Overhaul Now Dividing Israel? Two New Yorkers.
articles.snippet: Kohelet, the once-obscure think tank that conceived and now champions a revamped court system, is an American import.
articles.abstract: Kohelet, the once-obscure think tank that conceived and now champions a revamped court system, is an American import.
articles.lead_paragraph: As part of a recent “national day of resistance,” a group of army reservists wearing masks converged at the Jerusalem office of a think tank and blocked its front door with sandbags and coils of barbed wire. Outside, protesters led a noisy rally on the street, waving dozens of placards and sharing a microphone for a series of furious speeches.
articles.byline: By David Segal and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: Putin and Xi Celebrate Ties Unbroken by Russia’s War in Ukraine
articles.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin welcomed Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, to Russia, briefly noting Beijing’s peace plan for Ukraine but stressing Moscow and Beijing’s enduring partnership.
articles.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin welcomed Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, to Russia, briefly noting Beijing’s peace plan for Ukraine but stressing Moscow and Beijing’s enduring partnership.
articles.lead_paragraph: Standing side by side in a show of partnership unshaken by Russia’s yearlong war in Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin and China’s top leader, Xi Jinping, began talks in Moscow on Monday with boasts of their close ties and only understated mention of the conflict itself.
articles.byline: By Valerie Hopkins, Chris Buckley and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: Inside the 3 Months That Could Cost Fox $1.6 Billion
articles.snippet: The decision by Fox News executives in November 2020 to treat the more hard-right Newsmax as a mortal threat spawned a possibly more serious danger.
articles.abstract: The decision by Fox News executives in November 2020 to treat the more hard-right Newsmax as a mortal threat spawned a possibly more serious danger.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since 2002, when Fox News first overtook CNN as the most-watched cable news channel, one thing has been as certain and predictable as its dominance: Every time a Democrat wins the White House, the right-leaning network’s ratings take a momentary dip.

articles.headline: Where High Interest Rates Have Sent Home Prices Sliding
articles.snippet: In Sweden, the central bank’s fight against inflation is crimping economic growth and has contributed to a 15 percent drop in home prices.
articles.abstract: In Sweden, the central bank’s fight against inflation is crimping economic growth and has contributed to a 15 percent drop in home prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Madeleine Eiswohld decided to move in with her boyfriend last year, she never expected to find it so difficult to sell her apartment. It’s a cozy studio, with lots of natural light, in Huddinge, an increasingly desirable suburb of Stockholm.

articles.headline: Strains Emerge Inside the Union That Beat Amazon
articles.snippet: Nearly a year after its victory on Staten Island, the Amazon Labor Union is grappling with election losses and internal conflict.
articles.abstract: Nearly a year after its victory on Staten Island, the Amazon Labor Union is grappling with election losses and internal conflict.
articles.lead_paragraph: One year after its surprise victory at a Staten Island warehouse, the only union in the country representing Amazon workers has endured a series of setbacks and conflicts that have caused longtime supporters to question if it will survive.

articles.headline: Ferraris and Hungry Children: Venezuela’s Socialist Vision in Shambles
articles.snippet: After years of extreme scarcity, some Venezuelans lead lives of luxury as others scrape by. The nation of grinding hardship has increasingly become one of haves and have-nots.
articles.abstract: After years of extreme scarcity, some Venezuelans lead lives of luxury as others scrape by. The nation of grinding hardship has increasingly become one of haves and have-nots.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — In the capital, a store sells Prada purses and a 110-inch television for $115,000. Not far away, a Ferrari dealership has opened, while a new restaurant allows well-off diners to enjoy a meal seated atop a giant crane overlooking the city.
articles.byline: By Isayen Herrera, Frances Robles and Adriana Loureiro Fernandez

articles.headline: Video Shows Virginia Man’s Death in Custody
articles.snippet: Irvo Otieno’s death was a devastating ending to a journey that began when his family immigrated from Kenya when he was a young boy, “compelled by the American dream.”
articles.abstract: Irvo Otieno’s death was a devastating ending to a journey that began when his family immigrated from Kenya when he was a young boy, “compelled by the American dream.”
articles.lead_paragraph: HENRICO, Va. — Surveillance video from a state psychiatric hospital in Virginia shows a group of sheriff’s deputies and medical staff members piling on a handcuffed man, Irvo Otieno, and pinning him on the floor for around 11 minutes, until his death on March 6.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Christine Hauser

articles.headline: Google Releases Bard, Its Competitor in the Race to Create A.I. Chatbots
articles.snippet: The internet giant will grant users access to a chatbot after years of cautious development, chasing splashy debuts from rivals OpenAI and Microsoft.
articles.abstract: The internet giant will grant users access to a chatbot after years of cautious development, chasing splashy debuts from rivals OpenAI and Microsoft.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than three months, Google executives have watched as projects at Microsoft and a San Francisco start-up called OpenAI have stoked the public’s imagination with the potential for artificial intelligence.
articles.byline: By Nico Grant and Cade Metz
